title: A person sold an article at a loss of 8%. Had he sold it at a gain of 10.5% he would have received Rs. 37 more. What is the cost price of the article? - Quora

response.answer_text: ANSWER: Cost price of the article (Rs) = 200 SOLUTION: Let ‘x’ be the cost price of the article. Sale price with 8% loss = x-(8/100)x= x-0.08x = x(1–0.08) = 0.92 x Had the article been sold with 10.5% gain, then its sale price would be: Sale price= x+ (10.5/100)x = x+0.105x) = x(1+0.105) = 1.105 x As per statement made, 1.105x = 0.92x+37 => 1.105x-0.92x = 37 => 0.185x = 37 => x = 37/0.185 = 200

Ans Let C.P of an article = Rs 100 Actual loss = 8 % = Rs 8 S.P = 100 - 8 = Rs 92 Assumed gain = 10.5 % = Rs 10.5 Assumed S.P = 100 + 10.5 = Rs 110.5 Difference in S.P's = 110.5 - 92 = Rs 18.5 Applying unitary method If difference in S.P is 18.5 than C.P = Rs 100 If difference in S.P is 1 than C.P = 100/18.5 If difference in S.P is 37 than C.P = (100/18.5) × 37 Rs 200 Ans.
Let the cost of article be 100x Sold at 8% loss = 92x 110.5x = 92x + 37 18.5x= 37 x =2 100x = Rs 200 ANSWER
